title: 514. Roland Fryer Refuses to Lie to Black America
description: The controversial Harvard economist, recently back from a suspension, “broke a lot of glass early in my career,” he says. His research on school incentives and police brutality won him acclaim — but also enemies. Now he’s taking a hard look at corporate diversity programs. The common thread in his work? “I refuse to not tell the truth.”
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
